DK.category: Transport of passengers and their accompanying luggage
DK.description:
Taxis, scheduled busses, trains and air transport are exempted. In connection with international transportation of passengers the exemption also covers accompanying luggage.
Passenger transport in tourist busses and similar vehicles (CPA 49.39.32, 49.39.33, 49.39.34) are subject to VAT in Denmark (Standard rate).

DK.category: Supply of goods and services by organisations recognised as being devoted to social wellbeing by Member States and engaged in welfare or social security work
DK.description: Delivery of goods and services related to charitable events - e.g. collection and sale of used items of little value - is exempt under certain conditions according to section 13(1)(17). Exemption obtained by prior application to the tax authorities on condition that the event does not distort competition in relation to commercial enterprises. An application for exemption is based on a specific assessment (event has a charitable purpose or has a commercial character).

DK.category: Supply of services by writers, composers and performing artists, or of the royalties due to them
Admission to shows, theatres, circuses, fairs, amusement parks, concerts, museums, zoos, cinemas, exhibitions and similar cultural events and facilities
DK.description: Services related to cultural activities, including libraries, museums, zoos and the like and supply of goods and services closely related to these services are exempt from VAT. The exemption does not cover radio and television broadcasts, movie display and theatre performances, concerts, etc.
Supply of services in connection with non-commercial sports and physical activities are exempt from VAT.
The exemption does not cover events with professional athletes as participants. It is a condition that the supplier is not acting for the purpose of gaining profit.

This is not an exhaustive list, but an indicative one. When supplied in the course of catering or from a vending machine, these foods become liable to the reduced rate. Certain other foods are Standard Rated.

IE.category: Pharmaceutical products of a kind normally used for health care, prevention of illness and as treatment for medical and veterinary purposes, including products used for contraception and sanitary protection
IE.description: Human Oral Medicine, Oral Contraception, and sanitary products are zero-rated for VAT purposes (except for menstrual cups, menstrual sponges and period pants to which the 13.5% rate applies). Animal Oral medicine is also zero-rated (excluding medicine for dogs, cats, cage birds or domestic pets, which is standard rated. All non-oral animal medicines are also standard rated.)

IE.category: Supply, including on loan by libraries, of books, newspapers and periodicals either on physical means of support or supplied electronically or both (including brochures, leaflets and similar printed matter, childrens picture, drawing or colouring books, music printed or in manuscript form, maps and hydrographic or similar charts), other than publications wholly or predominantly devoted to advertising and other than publications wholly or predominantly consisting of video content or audible music.
IE.description: The Zero Rate applies to printed books, atlases  , annual publications, children’s picture, colouring and music books  . For a printed booklet to qualify for the zero rating, it must consist of essentially pictorial or textual matter, must have a distinctive front cover devoid of body text, must be no less than eight pages (excluding the cover) and must be bound, stitched or stapled.

IE.category: Medical equipment, aids and other appliances normally intended to alleviate or treat disability, for the exclusive personal use of the disabled, including the repair of such goods
IE.description: Comments Certain Medical equipment, aids and their parts are at the 0% VAT rate. This includes, invalid carriages, orthopaedic appliances, surgical belts, artificial limbs, artificial parts of the body,  and deaf aids, walking frames, crutches, and parts of same. This does not include artificial teeth, corrective spectacles, or contact lenses. For specific queries, more detail can be found on the Revenue Commissioner's VAT Rates Database - https://www.revenue.ie/en/vat/vat-rates/index.aspx
The Standard Rate of VAT was temporarily reduced from 23% to 21% from 1 September 2020 to 28 February 2021. It has been restored to 23% from 1 March 2021.

NL.category: Accommodation provided in hotels and similar establishments, including the provision of holiday accommodation and the letting of places on camping or caravan sites
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.11: providing accommodation within a hotel, guesthouse and holiday business to persons who stay for only a short period. The terms 'hotel, guesthouse and holiday business' must be interpreted according to parlance. Whether the stay is considered short-term depends on the nature and duration of the stay. Stays for a maximum of six months, during which the guests do not relocate the center of their social life to the accommodation are included; longer stays usually are not.

NL.category: Accommodation provided in hotels and similar establishments, including the provision of holiday accommodation and the letting of places on camping or caravan sites
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.10: providing the opportunity to camp within the context of a camping and holiday business to persons who only stay there for a short period. The term "camp and holiday business" should be interpreted according to parlance. It is not required that the lessor provides the additional services that camping sites normally provide. 'providing the opportunity to camp' must also be interpreted according to parlance.

NL.category: Restaurant and catering services, it being possible to exclude the supply of (alcoholic and/or non-alcoholic) beverages
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.12: serving out foodstuffs for human consumption, for use on site within the context of a hotel, café, restaurant, guesthouse and related businesses. The supply of freshly prepared food or edible products for immediate consumption in snack bars, snack vans, cinema foyers, sports club canteens and such is considered a supply of goods, unless the services accompanying the delivery of the foodstuffs predominate.

NL.category: Admission to shows, theatres, circuses, fairs, amusement parks, concerts, museums, zoos, cinemas, exhibitions and similar cultural events and facilities
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.14 to b.15: granting access to circuses; zoos; public museums or collections (including closely related supplies of goods, such as catalogs, photographs); music and stage performances, including lectures (excluding peep shows/other performances primarily aimed at erotic entertainment); cinemas; amusement parks, playgrounds and gardens, other facilities primarily and permanently furnished to entertainment and day recreation.

NL.category: Window cleaning and cleaning in private households
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.20: regular cleaning services regarding the interior of private households (including closed corridors) are included. Excluded: cleaning services regarding the exterior of private households, cleaning services regarding other buildings than private households and cleaning services that are not considered regular cleaning services regularly performed by a cleaner (such as special services performed with special equipment, e.g. cleaning of chimney, central heating).

NL.category: Supply of services by writers, composers and performing artists, or of the royalties due to them
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.17: performances by performing artists. This includes performances by artists in music and stage performances as meant in the foregoing item. The reduced VAT rate only applies to performances that can be (in)directly heard or viewed by an audience. Rehearsals associated with and necessary for those performances are included. Excluded: providing the opportunity to participate in a performance and organizing performances.

NL.category: Use of sporting facilities
NL.description:
Tabel I prov. b.3.: Providing the opportunity to exercise and bath. Only included is granting the right to use a sports facility that serves sports activities by humans.
Sports facility: usually an immovable property that is equipped for human exercise. Public spaces such as roads, forests and an airport intended for a gliding club and the like can also form a sports accommodation if these spaces are reserved for sporting activities for the duration of the sport.

NL.category: Use of sporting facilities
NL.description: Since December 18th 2020 a temporary provision is in force, approving that the reduced rate of 9% is applied to providing online sports lessons.

NL.category: Admission to sporting events
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.14, f: the granting of access to spectators of sports competitions, demonstrations and the like. Sports competitions are events where people actively participate in sports. Sports demonstrations are, for example, shows of the Harlem Globetrotters (basketball), performances of the Spanish Riding School (horse dressage) and shows of Wrestlemania (wrestling).

NL.category: Minor repairs of shoes and leather goods
NL.description: Tabel I prov. b.5: Footwear: all kinds of footwear such as (sports) shoes, sandals, ski boots. Skates, inline skates and such can be regarded as footwear for the shoe part. Which material the footwear is made of is irrelevant. 'Leather goods' include small articles made from leather (leather suitcases and bags, gloves, wallets and belts, etc). Repair of large leather utensils (such as furniture); grinding and straightening skates and supplies of goods sold separately (laces etc.)are excluded.

NL.category: Minor repairs of clothing and household linen (including mending and alteration)
NL.description:
Tabel I prov. b.6 Household linen: all textile items used in a household (curtains, cloths, and (beach) towels, etc.). Rugs and the upholstery of sofas and chairs are not considered household linen. 
Both repairing and altering are included (sealing holes and tears and replacing buttons, zippers, lengthening/shortening and tightenig/loosening etc.). Excluded are, a.o.: washing, dry cleaning, steaming, pressing, embroidery/appliqué, and  production of clothing/household linen on commission.

NL.category: Minor repairs of bicycles
NL.description:
Tabel I prov. b.4: 'Bicycles' include electric bicycles. Mopeds are not considered bicycles. Tricycles for the disabled are regarded as vehicles for the disabled and therefore subjected to the reduced rate on a different basis. 
Repairing: the repair services performed on bicycles by bicycle repairers (replacing parts, repairing tires, performing (preventive) maintenance, etc). The reduced VAT rate only applies to the repair service. Supplies of bicycles, parts and accessories are excluded.

PL.category: Supply of services by undertakers and cremation services, and the supply of goods related thereto

Pharmaceutical products of a kind normally used for health care, prevention of illness and as treatment for medical and veterinary purposes, including products used for contraception and sanitary protection
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CN codes to those products. Pursuant to Article 41(2),146aa (1)(2) item 14 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax the VAT reduced rate is applied to medicinal products admitted to trading in the territory of Poland in accordance with the provisions of Act of 6 September 2001-Pharmaceutical Law and those that have obtained a permit issued by the Council of the EU or the European Commission (regardless of CN).

PL.category: Medical equipment, aids and other appliances normally intended to alleviate or treat disability, for the exclusive personal use of the disabled, including the repair of such goods
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CN codes with respect to those items. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146aa (1) (2),item 13 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax the VAT reduced rate is applied to medical devices within the meaning of the Act of 20 May 2010 on medical devices admitted to trading in the territory of Poland (regardless of CN codes).

PL.category: Admission to shows, theatres, circuses, fairs, amusement parks, concerts, museums, zoos, cinemas, exhibitions and similar cultural events and facilities
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes with respect to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146aa (1) (2), item 64, 65, 66, 68 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax the VAT reduced rate is applied to admission to (regardless of CPA codes): artistic performances,including circus performances, cultural facilities;amusement parks,theme parks, discos, dance halls; libraries, archives, museums and other cultural services; other services related to leisure.

PL.category: Reception of radio and television broadcasting services
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146aa(1)(2),item 48 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax the 8% rate is applied to services, other than electronic services (regardless of CPA codes), consisting in enabling reception of TV and radio programmes, within the meaning of Radio and TV Broadcasting regulations,by means of reception facilities,excluding rental of films and programmes at a time chosen by the recipient

PL.category: Supply of services by writers, composers and performing artists, or of the royalties due to them
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes with respect to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146aa (1) (20) item 63 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax the  VAT reduced rate is applied to services of authors and performers within the meaning of the Act of 4 February 1994 on copyright and related rights remunerated in the form of fees for the transfer or licensing of copyrights or rights to artistic performance (regardless of CPA codes).

PL.category: Provision, construction, renovation and alteration of housing, as part of a social policy
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes to those services. The 8% rate is applied to services regarding building structures or parts thereof included in house-construction covered by a social housing programme within the meaning of and in line with the rules laid down in Article 41, paragraphs 12-12e of Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax.

PL.category: The renovation and repair of private dwellings, excluding materials which account for a significant part of the value of the service supplied
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes to those services. The 8% rate is applied to services regarding building structures or parts thereof included in house-construction covered by a social housing programme within the meaning of and in line with the rules laid down in Article 41, paragraphs 12-12e of Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax.

PL.category: Admission to sporting events
PL.description: The Polish VAT rules do not provide for CPA codes with respect to those services. Pursuant to Article 41(2), 146aa (1)(2), item 67 of Annex 3 to Act of 11 March 2004 on Goods and Services Tax the VAT reduced rate is applied to admission to sporting events regardless of CPA codes.

PL.category: Reception of radio and television broadcasting services
PL.description: continuation (rental of audio and video content on-demand, TV licence are subject to 23% VAT rate).

PL.category: Pharmaceutical products of a kind normally used for health care, prevention of illness and as treatment for medical and veterinary purposes, including products used for contraception and sanitary protection
PL.description: The 0% rate is applied (until 31 December 2022) to COVID-19 vaccines: a) admitted to trading in the territory of Poland in accordance with the provisions of the Act of 6 September 2001 - Pharmaceutical Law, b) that have obtained a permit issued by the Council of the European Union or the European Commission.

PL.category: Medical equipment, aids and other appliances normally intended to alleviate or treat disability, for the exclusive personal use of the disabled, including the repair of such goods
PL.description: The 0% VAT rate is applied (until 31 December 2022) to tests for SARS-CoV-2 and the COVID-19 in vitro diagnostic medical devices within the meaning of: a) the Act of 20 May 2010 on medical devices, b) Regulation (EU) 2017/746 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 5 April 2017 on in vitro diagnostic medical devices – admitted to trading in the territory of Poland.

PT.category: Enamels on copper, executed entirely by hand, limited to eight numbered copies bearing the signature of the artist or the studio, excluding articles of jewellery and goldsmith’s and silversmith’s wares
PT.description: Portuguese VAT law does not depend of CN or CPA codes to apply reduced taxes rates. For this reason, the following codes are approximate and not legally binding. For sake of certainty, reference should be made to the Portuguese VAT law (decree law n.º 394-B/1984, of December 28)

PT.category: Temporary Parking Rates (Articles 118 and 119 of the VAT Directive)
PT.description:
The parking rate of 13% applies to:
1. Wine
2. Agricultural tools and utensils, mobile silos, tractors, pumps and other machinery
designed exclusively or mainly for the purpose of agriculture, cattle breeding or
forestry.
3. Diesel for the agriculture.

PT.category: Special reduced rate for specific regions (including articles 104, 105 and 120 of the VAT Directive)
PT.description: Azores Autonomous Region

PT.category: Special reduced rate for specific regions (including articles 104, 105 and 120 of the VAT Directive)
PT.description: Madeira Autonomous Region

RO.category: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs
RO.description: 5% - high quality foods (mountain, eco and traditional products, authorized by the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development) - see art. 291 para. (3) lett. k) of Fiscal Code.

RO.category: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs
RO.description: 9% - food, including beverages, excluding alcoholic beverages, intended for human and animal consumption, live animals and poultry of domestic species, seeds, plants and ingredients used in the preparation of foodstuffs, products used to supplement or replace foodstuffs – see art. 291 para. (2) lett. e) of Fiscal Code and point 37 para. (4), (8) - (11) of Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Supply, including on loan by libraries, of books, newspapers and periodicals either on physical means of support or supplied electronically or both (including brochures, leaflets and similar printed matter, childrens picture, drawing or colouring books, music printed or in manuscript form, maps and hydrographic or similar charts), other than publications wholly or predominantly devoted to advertising and other than publications wholly or predominantly consisting of video content or audible music.
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for the supply of school textbooks, books, newspapers and magazines, except those intended exclusively or mainly for advertising. See art. 291 para. (3) letter a) of the Fiscal Code corroborated with point 38 para. (1) of the Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Transport of passengers and their accompanying luggage
RO.description: Transport of persons by historic trains or vehicles with steam traction along narrow lines for tourist or leisure purposes; transportation of persons using cable transport facilities - cable car, gondola, chairlift, ski lift - for tourist or leisure purposes; transport of persons with vehicles with animal traction, used for tourist or recreational purposes; transport of persons with boats used for tourist or leisure purposes. See art 291 para. (3) lett. g)-j) of the Fiscal Code.

RO.category: Accommodation provided in hotels and similar establishments, including the provision of holiday accommodation and the letting of places on camping or caravan sites
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for accommodation in the hotel sector or sectors with similar function, including renting of camping sites. For details see art. 291 para. (3) letter d) of the Fiscal Code corroborated with point 37 para. (3) of the Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Restaurant and catering services, it being possible to exclude the supply of (alcoholic and/or non-alcoholic) beverages
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for restaurant and catering services, except for alcoholic beverages, other than beer falling within CN code 22 03 00 10. For details see art. 291 para. (3) letter e) of the Fiscal Code corroborated with point 37 para. (12) of the Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Admission to shows, theatres, circuses, fairs, amusement parks, concerts, museums, zoos, cinemas, exhibitions and similar cultural events and facilities
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for the services consisting in allowing access to castles, museums, memorial houses, historical monuments, architectural and archaeological monuments, zoological and botanical gardens, fairgrounds, amusement parks and recreational parks, fairs, exhibitions and cultural events, cinemas, other than those exempted according to art. 292 para. (1) letter m) of the Fiscal Code. See art. 291 para. (3) letter b) of the Fiscal Code.

RO.category: Provision, construction, renovation and alteration of housing, as part of a social policy
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for the supply of housing as part of social policy, including the land on which they are built. For details see art. 291 para (3) letter c) of the Fiscal Code corroborated with point 38 para. (2), (3) and (4) of the Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Admission to sporting events
RO.description: See art. 291 para. (3) letter b) of the Fiscal Code.

RO.category: Use of sporting facilities
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for the right to use the sports facilities whose activities are classified under CAEN codes 9311 and 9313, for the purpose of practicing sport and physical education, other than those exempted according to art. 292 para. (1) letter l) of the Fiscal Code. For details see art. 291 para. (3) letter f) of the Fiscal Code.

RO.category: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs
RO.description: The reduced rate is applied by the supplier only if he can prove that the goods are used for the preparation or to supplement or replace food for human or animal consumption. When those goods are imported from a third territory or a third country, the application of the reduced rate is conditioned by the submission of the Commitment Declaration regarding the destination of the goods for which the application of the reduced VAT rate is requested. Point 37 para. (5) - (7) of Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate shall be applied for the supply of fertilizers and pesticides used in agriculture, seeds and other agricultural products intended for sowing or planting, corresponding to the CN codes mentioned below.

RO.category: Pharmaceutical products of a kind normally used for health care, prevention of illness and as treatment for medical and veterinary purposes, including products used for contraception and sanitary protection
RO.description: The reduced TVA rate is applied for the supply of medicines for human and veterinary use. See art. 291 para. (2) letter c) of the Fiscal Code.

RO.category: Medical equipment, aids and other appliances normally intended to alleviate or treat disability, for the exclusive personal use of the disabled, including the repair of such goods
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for the supply of prostheses and their accessories, with the exception of dental prostheses exempt from tax under art. 292 para. (1) letter (b), and the supply of orthopedic products. See art. 291 para. (2) letters a) and b) of the Fiscal Code point 37 para. (1) and (2) of the Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Medical equipment, aids and other appliances normally intended to alleviate or treat disability, for the exclusive personal use of the disabled, including the repair of such goods
RO.description: When the goods having these CN codes are imported from a third territory or a third country, the application of the reduced VAT rate is conditioned by submission of the Customs Notice for medical devices or the Declaration of conformity of the medical device manufacturer according to art.12 of the Order of the Minister of Health no. 1009/2016 regarding the registration of medical devices in the national database.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Fertilization; Ploughing; Harrowing; Preparing the seedbed with combine and moulding soil; Seed sowing or planting; Land rolling; Spraying, dusting - fight diseases and pests, herbicide; Harvesting or crop dislocation; Collecting and baling the vegetal material, by pressing in bales; Hoeing crops; Executing or opening drains in order to shape the soil for vegetables - referred to in points 1 - 7, 9, 10, 12, 13 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Pots planting for potatoes and vegetables; Mowing; Raking; Forage silage and fodder storage works in livestock farms; Meadow overseeding; Planting horticultural grape vines, trees; Deforestation of vineyards and orchards; Installation of support, growing and palisade system for vineyards and orchards - referred to in points 15, 18 - 20, 28, 35 - 37 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Specific works for manure discharge and providing the feed in or from animal breeding farms; Disinfection, plague and pest control in livestock farms; Sheep shearing; Eggs sorting, marking and packing; Cleaning animal hooves - referred to in points the activities 29 - 33 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Collecting and baling the vegetal material, by pressing in bales (post-harvest services); Chopping the vegetable scraps; Topping sugar beet; Lining, baling, tying tobacco; Collecting, sorting, conditioning, labelling of vegetables and fruits works - referred to in points 10, 11, 16, 17, 25 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Treatment of seeds used in setting up of the agricultural crops, with plant protection products referred to in point 8 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Chopping wood cords, branches referred to in point 24 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of water
RO.description: The reduced VAT rate is applied for the supply of water for irrigation in agriculture and for water supply and sewerage services. See art. 291 para. (2) letters g) and i) of the Fiscal Code and point 37 para. (13) letter b) of the Methodological Norms.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Installation of irrigation/fertigation system in vineyards and orchards referred to in point 38 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Clearing or cleaning irrigation and/or drainage channels referred to in point 34 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Services to combat soil erosion such as coastal and port construction works, dams, locks and other hydromechanical structures (for the case of water erosion); Flood defense services - referred to in point 42 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016, respectively in Order no. 157/2011.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Levelling the agricultural land, which ensures a flat surface of the crop land, by reducing the micro-relief deviations caused by the other agricultural works; Soil scarification or deep loosening on compacted soils; Unclogging the soil at great depths, in order to favor the roots growth; Digging holes for planting trees and vines - referred to in points 14, 21 - 23 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Cleaning of unwanted vegetation and destruction of heaps on pastures and hayfields; Arrangement of water sources for the animals on meadows, parcelling of meadows; Draining services -referred to in points 27, 28, 42 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016. Draining services are provided in point 42 of Order no. 1155/868/2016, respectively in Order no. 157/2011.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Operations for installing protected spaces, respectively greenhouses and/or solariums; Installation of hail and rain protection systems in vineyards and orchards - referred to in points 26 and 39 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Setting up and maintenance of genealogical registers of animal breeds; Determination of the genetic quality of animals referred to in points 40, 41 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Disinfection, plague and pest control in wineries and vegetable and fruit storage warehouses referred to in point 30 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016.

RO.category: Supply of goods and services of a kind normally intended for use in agricultural production but excluding capital goods such as machinery or buildings
RO.description: The reduced rate shall be applied for Services to combat soil erosion such as Other landscape maintenance services (for the case of wind erosion) referred to in point 42 of the Annex to the Order no. 1155/868/2016, respectively in the Order no. 157/2011.

SE.category: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs
SE.description:
- Foodstuffs referred to in article 2 in regulation EC no 178/2002 are subject to reduced VAT rate, with the exception for tap water and certain alcoholic beverages, see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act.
- Goods with CN code 2203 can be subject to reduced VAT rate provided that the alcohol content is maximum 3.5 volume percent. Goods with CN code 28-29, 3201-3206, 3301-3302, 3501-3505, 3507 can be subject to reduced VAT rate if they constitute food additives.

SE.category: Tapestries (CN code 5805 00 00) and wall textiles (CN code 6304 00 00) made by hand from original designs provided by artists, provided that there are not more than eight copies of each
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports and to supplies made by the artist or the artist’s estate, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Pictures, collages and similar decorative plaques, paintings and drawings, executed entirely by hand by the artist, other than plans and drawings for architectural, engineering, industrial, commercial, topographical or similar purposes, hand-decorated manufactured articles, theatrical scenery, studio back cloths or the like of painted canvas (CN code 9701)
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports and to supplies made by the artist or the artist’s estate, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Original engravings, prints and lithographs, being impressions produced in the limited numbers directly in black and white or in colour of one or of several plates executed entirely by hand by the artist, irrespective of the process or of the material employed, but not including any mechanical or photomechanical process (CN code 9702 00 00)
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports and to supplies made by the artist or the artist’s estate, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Sculpture casts the production of which is limited to eight copies and supervised by the artist or his successors in title (CN code 9703 00 00) on an exceptional basis, in cases determined by the Member States, the limit of eight copies may be exceeded for statuary casts produced before 1 January 1989
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports and to supplies made by the artist or the artist’s estate, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Original sculptures and statuary, in any material, provided that they are executed entirely by the artists
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports and to supplies made by the artist or the artist’s estate, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Postage or revenue stamps, postmarks, first-day covers, pre-stamped stationery and the like, used, or if unused not current and not intended to be current (CN code 9704 00 00)
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Collections and collector’s pieces of zoological, botanical, mineralogical, ethnographic or numismatic interest (CN code 9705 00 00)
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Goods, other than works of art or collector’s items, which are more than 100 years old (CN code 9706 00 00)
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to imports, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Accommodation provided in hotels and similar establishments, including the provision of holiday accommodation and the letting of places on camping or caravan sites
SE.description: Please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Restaurant and catering services, it being possible to exclude the supply of (alcoholic and/or non-alcoholic) beverages
SE.description: Excluding alcoholic beverages. Please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Minor repairs of shoes and leather goods
SE.description: Please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Minor repairs of clothing and household linen (including mending and alteration)
SE.description: Please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Minor repairs of bicycles
SE.description: Please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 2 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Supply of services by writers, composers and performing artists, or of the royalties due to them
SE.description: The reduced rate applies to royalties, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 3 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7). A performing artist`s (actor, musician, dancer, artist) performance of a literary or artistic work is exempt.

SE.category: Admission to shows, theatres, circuses, fairs, amusement parks, concerts, museums, zoos, cinemas, exhibitions and similar cultural events and facilities
SE.description: Admission to shows, theatres, circuses, concerts, operas, ballets and similar performances are subject to 6 % VAT. The reduced rate also applies to admission to zoos. However, arrangement of public exhibitions in museums and supplies of items to such exhibitions are exempt if the museum is run by the public sector or is supported by the public sector. Admission to amusement parks and cinemas are subject to the standard VAT rate. Please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 3 in the Swedish VAT Act.

SE.category: Supply, including on loan by libraries, of books, newspapers and periodicals either on physical means of support or supplied electronically or both (including brochures, leaflets and similar printed matter, childrens picture, drawing or colouring books, music printed or in manuscript form, maps and hydrographic or similar charts), other than publications wholly or predominantly devoted to advertising and other than publications wholly or predominantly consisting of video content or audible music.
SE.description: The reduced rate comprises both supplies on physical means and electronic supplies of books, newspapers etc., please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 3 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Admission to sporting events
SE.description: Usually exempted if supplied by a public body or non-profit making organization. The reduced rate is regulated in chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 3 in the Swedish VAT Act ((https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Use of sporting facilities
SE.description: Usually exempted if supplied by a public body or non-profit making organization. The reduced rate is regulated in chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 3 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Zero and Reduced Rates: Articles 109-122 (Title VIII, Chapter 4) of the VAT Directive
SE.description: Zero rate is applied on medicines supplied on prescription or sold to hospitals, or imported into the country to be supplied on prescription or sold to hospitals. Please find the regulation in chapter 3 section 23 in the Swedish VAT Act.

SE.category: Zero and Reduced Rates: Articles 109-122 (Title VIII, Chapter 4) of the VAT Directive
SE.description: Certain services regarding production of periodicals issued by non-profit organisations (basically printing services).

SE.category: Zero Rate: Article 37 of the VAT Directive
SE.description: Supplies of goods on ships and aircrafts for consumption on board.

SE.category: Medical equipment, aids and other appliances normally intended to alleviate or treat disability, for the exclusive personal use of the disabled, including the repair of such goods
SE.description: The reduced rate comprises certain cassette books, cassette magazines and reading aids, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 3 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7).

SE.category: Transport of passengers and their accompanying luggage
SE.description: Domestic transports of passengers are subject to the reduced rate, please see chapter 7 section 1 paragraph 3 in the Swedish VAT Act (https://www.riksdagen.se/sv/dokument-lagar/dokument/svensk-forfattningssamling/mervardesskattelag-1994200_sfs-1994-200#K7). International transports of passengers are exempted.

SI.category: Foodstuffs (including beverages but excluding alcoholic beverages) for human and animal consumption; live animals, seeds, plants and ingredients normally intended for use in the preparation of foodstuffs; products normally used to supplement foodstuffs or as a substitute for foodstuffs
SI.description: 01207 99 96: Pumpkin seed; 1208 90 00: Ground poppy seed; 1212 99 95: Edible pits, seeds, kernels and other; 1302 19 70: Sap and plant extracts; 1214: Including common sainfoin; 2501 00 10: Salt; 2501 00 91: Salt; 2530 90 00: Sepiolite, also known as meerschaum; 2934 99 90: Acesulfame potassium; 2923 20 00: Lecithin; 2925 11 00: Saccharin and its salts; 3001 20 90: Royal jelly; 0407 11 00: Fertilized hatching eggs (Gallus domesticus)

SI.description: 9021: Except orthopaedic products for animals; 9021 90 90: Custom-made orthopaedic footwear; 64: Only temporary post-operative footwear, but not serially made footwear with custom-designed arch support used for treatment of flat feet; 3214 10 10, 3506 10 00 and 9018 39 00: Stoma care products: pouches for colostomy, ileostomy and urostomy; stomahesive baseplates, skin tapes and adhesives; 3926 90 97: Breast prosthesis; 9027 90 00: Blood glucose test strips; 9018 31 90 and 9018 31 10: Insulin ...
